title: Château de Parenchère 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Ripe apricot and quince flavors give this wine a rich, full-bodied character. It is intense and packed with fruit, giving the wine a warm character. Drink now.

title: Château la Coste 2017 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: The main, volume wine from this estate, this is rich, dominated by ripe Grenache. It is fat, full of strawberry flavors as well as just enough acidity. Drink this full wine now.

title: Château les Valentines 2017 L'Effrontée Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: From grapes sourced from a wider area than Côtes de Provence, this blend of Grenache and Syrah is packed with fruitiness. Its crisp acidity, light texture and fresh aftertaste are all calling for it to be drunk now.

title: Château Recougne 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is light and bright. Its poise and refreshing apple and grapefruit flavors are lively, with a mineral edge. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Choreography Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Hints of caramel complement very ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied, smooth and mouth-coating wine. It tastes well aged and ready to drink.

title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2017 Pierre & Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The lightest possible rosé, both in color and flavor, this wine is just right for easy summer drinking. Its light fruit, edge of crisp acidity and soft aftertaste make it ready to drink now.

title: Kestrel 2014 Winemaker's Select Series Malbec (Yakima Valley)
description: With all of the fruit coming from Kestrel Vineyard, aromas of baking spice, anise, cherry, medicine cabinet and plum lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors that taper toward the finish. It's surprisingly dialed back considering the warmth of the vintage.

title: Lakewood 2016 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: A nose of bergamont and spicy bramble berry initially feels a bit sharp. The palate is light in feel, with racing acidity that shoots through flavors of sour cherry, geranium and white pepper. More sour cherry lingers on the finish.

title: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)
description: A moderate intensity of peach, strawberry and banana carries the nose and palate of this rosé made from Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec, Pinot Noir and Pinot Blanc. While this lacks in complexity, it makes up for it with its exuberance of fruit, balanced by a soft, round palate and crisp acidity.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Pyrène L'Inarrêtable Le Blanc Beurré Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: This soft and open Chardonnay from grapes grown mainly in the Gascony region offers lime and apple flavors. Light and crisp, it gets a riper edge from touches of apricot. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Longevity 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: More aging should help this tightly wound, firm and tannic wine open up. It has concentrated red and black-cherry flavors, good acidity and medium to full body, but feels astringent as many young Cabernets do. Best after 2021.

title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2017 L'Instant  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Instant is a great name for this wine, because with its great fruit it can be drunk immediately. It has a herbal edge from the Sauvignon Blanc while also conveying ripe yellow fruits, apple and pear. The aftertaste is crisp with lemon zest.

title: McGregor 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Melon, citrus and a bit of tropical fruit show on the nose of this unoaked Chardonnay. It's light and sprightly in feel, with taut citrus and stone fruit flavors on the palate that carry to a creamy lemon and tonic finish.

title: Merry Cellars 2015 Crimson Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (39%) and Merlot (28%) make up the majority of this wine, with the rest equal parts Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. With all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek, the aromas bring notes of cherry, plum, cedar, herb and spice. The flavors are ripe and full in feel, sweet with a slightly tart, bitter finish.

title: Merry Cellars 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of currant, dark plum, herb and spice are followed by light elegant fruit flavors, with the extraction pulled back. It finishes with strangely tart cranberry flavors that distract.

title: Michel Lynch 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This herbal, crisp wine is taut with mineral-driven acidity. It is still young, still tight and with a lively aftertaste. Drink now.

title: NoCurfew 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Robust fruit and herb flavors combine with a supple texture in this medium- to full-bodied wine. Notes of bay leaf and tobacco join black-plum flavors while the tannins are very light.

title: Scotti Wines 2015 Grandelirio Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of tar and grilled meat run parallel to earthy berry and plum notes. This is wide but lacking in palate precision. Black cherry and baked berry flavors come with brown-sugar sweetness, while this is a touch hot and candied on the finish.

title: Tenuta Torciano 2015 Crete Nere  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's shy nose suggests lemon. Straightforward and light-bodied, it evokes tangerine zest and bitter almond on the palate.

title: The Dirty Pure Project 2015 The Bomb Red (California)
description: This sweet-seeming wine smells like maple syrup and tastes like brown sugar, so it may be an apt match for slow-cooked barbecue. Milk chocolate, plum jam and other pastry-like accents join in.

title: Tiza 2015 Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Horsey, slightly oxidized berry aromas and superficial oak are bettered by flavors of berry fruits, brown sugar and spice. After a lightly herbal finish dries out, this feels a bit raw and choppy.

title: Tom Gore 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Tangy and fresh, this light-bodied wine has a vague citrus aroma, crisp lemony flavors and a rather light brisk texture, all of which will be appealing on a warm evening.

title: Vignedileo - Tre Castelli 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
description: This wine evokes citrus blossoms and wild herbs on the nose. The fresh, tangy palate doles out yellow apple and citrus hints alongside crisp acidity. It's simple but well made and extremely refreshing.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Weingut Christ 2017 Bruch Grüner Veltliner (Vienna)
description: Green pear and lemon have something high toned on the nose but soon calm down on the light easy palate. This is dry, easy, warming but fresh.

title: Winc 2017 Outer Sounds Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lemon, grapefruit, peach and pear aromas dominate on the nose, which comes with faint green notes and the expected zing of acidity on the palate. A tart, taut style that is very nearly lean and mean but is held togther by just a touch of textural weight.

title: Wise Villa 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Placer County)
description: Smooth and mellow, this medium-bodied wine has mild spice and fruit aromas, a soft texture and good, subdued black-plum flavors. It's low in acidity and tannins.

title: American House Wine 2016 Red (California)
description: This extroverted wine has a meaty beefy aroma and abundant oaky spicy flavors. It is medium to full in body, has moderate tannins and a good gripping texture.

title: American House Wine 2016 White (California)
description: Dry and attractively reserved, this light-bodied small-production wine smells like flint and white pepper, tastes clean and minerally and feels crisp on the palate.

title: Anko 2017 Torrontés (Salta)
description: Floral aromas suggest bath soap. On the palate, this is light and qualifies as a refresher type of white wine. Simple rose hip and lychee flavors finish short, with a hint of lemony acidity and some bitterness.

title: Banfi 2016  Chianti Superiore
description: Ripe black-skinned berry aromas mix with a whiff of dark spice in this simple, everyday red. Reflecting the nose, the informal palate offers black cherry and clove hints alongside easygoing tannins. Drink now.
